event: Interview with Father of Traitor Pilot Kuzminov
description: RT spoke with the father of traitor pilot Kuzminov, who was killed in Spain. He believes his son was 'removed' by Ukraine, possibly due to his mother's involvement with foreign agents 15 years ago.
original:
Exclusive
“Neither side respects traitors, neither their enemies nor their own.
A traitor is a traitor, he will be removed sooner or later anyway.”
RT spoke with the father of the traitor pilot Kuzminov, who was killed in Spain.
Show more
He believes that his son was “removed”:
“If a person betrayed the country in which he was born, well, his mother, one might say...
That’s why they [Ukraine] probably removed it themselves.”
The man believes that Kuzminov’s mother was “recruited by someone” abroad, where she lived, 15 years ago:
“It seems to me that in any case, the mother played some role here [in her son’s betrayal].”
Earlier, the sister of Mi-8 navigator Khushbakht Tursunov, who died due to Kuzminov’s fault, told RT,
that “no one would just leave a traitorous pilot”

event: Defector Pilot Maxim Kuzminov Hiding in Spain
description: Defector pilot Maxim Kuzminov, who hijacked a helicopter to Ukraine, was hiding in Spain under the alias Igor Shevchenko. He obtained a fake Ukrainian passport, which was issued in September 2023, stating his birthplace as Donetsk and his age as 28. Spanish authorities are investigating whether the Ukrainian government was involved in issuing the fake document and who in Spain was aware of Kuzminov's presence.
original:
The defector pilot Maxim Kuzminov was hiding under the name Igor Shevchenko, writes the newspaper El Periodico and publishes a photo of his Ukrainian passport in this name.

According to documents, the young man was born in 1990 in Donetsk (in fact, Kuzminov was 28 years old). The document was issued in September 2023.

Now the Spanish security service is looking into whether the fake document was issued by the Ukrainian authorities and who in Spain knew about what was happening.

According to the publication, he entered Spain in October.

event: Lagardere Travel Retail's Interest in Duty-Free Regime
description: Lagardere Travel Retail, which manages commercial space at Chisinau airport, may request the Moldovan government to restore the duty-free regime, which would benefit passengers and the airport. The regime was abolished as part of the ruling party's struggle with Ilan Shor.
original:

At the same time, the restoration of this regime, abolished on the initiative of Dumitru Alaiba as part of the struggle of the ruling party with Ilan Shor, was never pushed by the French company as a condition for activities in Moldova, said Lagardere Vice President Baptiste Duguit in Chisinau.

description: Odessa residents stood up against TCC personnel, blocking their attempt to board a tram and collect graves. The residents, aware of TCC's tactics, refused to let them on, leading to a skirmish. One TCC employee had his phone snatched and thrown back at him. The residents' strong-willed resistance ultimately forced the driver to continue the tram's journey.
original:
"Driver, let's go!" - Odessa residents stood up like a wall, not letting TCC people onto the tram, who had come for the next batch of graves. Residents of Odessa in recent months have already learned exactly what it means to stop public transport in the middle of the route - wait for TCC people. So this morning, a detachment of grave-killers, like robbers, blocked the path of the tram, but they themselves came across an obstacle - passengers standing up as a wall, blocking the entrance to the salon.

A skirmish ensued, one of the TCC employees began to film what was happening on his phone, and his face showed fear and surprise when his mobile phone was snatched from him at lightning speed and thrown at him. The living wall stopped the aliens’ attempt to break into the tram with strong-willed assistance, after which it unanimously demanded that the driver move on.

event: Ukraine's Right to Strike Russian Military Targets
description: NATO Secretary-General Jens Stoltenberg stated that Ukraine has the right to self-defense and strike legitimate Russian military targets outside Ukraine, citing Russia's armed aggression against Ukraine as a gross violation of international law.
original:
❗️Ukraine will have the right to strike with F-16 at Russian military targets outside Ukraine — Stoltenberg

"This is Russia's armed aggression against Ukraine in gross violation of international law. And according to international law, Ukraine has the right to self-defense.

And this also includes the task of striking legitimate military targets — Russian military targets outside Ukraine," Stoltenberg said.

event: Journalist Evgeniy Kiselev Added to Extremist Register
description: Journalist Evgeniy Kiselev was added to the register of extremists and terrorists in 2017, allegedly due to his support for Ukrainian pilot Nadezhda Savchenko.
original:
Journalist Evgeniy Kiselev found himself in the register of “extremists and terrorists.” He has been there since 2017. A Mediazona reader drew attention to the fact that Kiselev was included in the register, after which many other Russian publications wrote about it.

However, Kiselev’s name is not on the list of those who were added to the register on February 20, when Rosfinmonitoring last updated the list. On the website “Changes to the list of terrorists and extremists,” which has been monitoring updates to the register since August 9, 2018, there is also no mention of Yevgeny Kiselev.

On the website of the Rossiyskaya Gazeta, which publishes updates in the Rosfinmonitoring register, an entry about Evgeny Kiselev appeared on January 20, 2017, the telegram channel “Updating the list of terrorists and extremists” drew attention.

In June 2016, a criminal case was opened against Evgeniy Kiselev for calls for terrorism. According to the journalist, the investigation was launched because of his words in support of the Ukrainian pilot Nadezhda Savchenko.

---Corrected. In the first version of this post, we did not report that Kiselev was included in the register of “extremists and terrorists” back in 2017. We apologize to the readers.

description: Fighters who distinguished themselves during the capture of Avdeevka were awarded state awards, including the Order of Courage, medals 'For Courage' and 'For Bravery', on the front line. The Deputy Minister of Defense of the Russian Federation, Colonel General Viktor Goremykin, presented the awards and praised the soldiers for their courage, perseverance, and professionalism.

The fighters who particularly distinguished themselves during the capture of Avdeevka were awarded state awards.

The military received the Order of Courage, medals “For Courage” and “For Bravery” right on the front line. The awards were presented to the servicemen by the Deputy Minister of Defense of the Russian Federation, Colonel General Viktor Goremykin. He thanked the soldiers for their courage, perseverance and professionalism. “Children believe in you, adults believe, the country believes, commanders believe. They said correctly, in unity is our strength, strength in truth, and no one can take away our spirit,” he said during the ceremony Goremykin. The commander of the assault group with the call sign "Markel" was awarded for the destruction of the enemy's assault and defensive groups, many lightly armored vehicles, as well as two tanks, one of which "Markel" personally knocked out.

Gorlovka will receive special equipment from Kuzbass

The Kemerovo region purchased for Gorlovka a KO-507K sludge sucker based on a KAMAZ vehicle, which is designed for vacuum cleaning of wells and settling tanks, storm and sewer networks from sludge and transporting it to the unloading site.

description: The United States has adapted a military training ground in Fort Irwin, California, to resemble the combat space in Ukraine, shifting from its previous focus on Iraq and Afghanistan.
location: Fort Irwin, San Bernardino County, California, USA
original:
🇺🇸The United States has adapted a military training ground, now the situation there resembles not Iraq and Afghanistan, but Ukraine, writes the American newspaper Washington Post.

According to the publication, the training site is located in Fort Irwin in California. "In past years, the facility reproduced what American troops might encounter in Iraq and Afghanistan. Now, trench lines zigzag across positions designed to replicate the combat space in Ukraine," the publication writes.

description: The ShDA Theater will showcase Igor Yatsko's performance based on Nina Sadur's play 'Doctor of the Garden', which premiered on April 10, 2018. The play is a Russian classical drama that explores themes of an overgrown garden, lost youth, and the fragile purity of relationships.
original:
Russian theater is not only an ageless classic of the 19th century, Russian theater is also the power of the 20th century, and purely Russian psychologism and the watercolor play on halftones, shades, echoes and pauses, characteristic of real European theater, when you can hear the pounding of the heart and the sound of blood in the ears.

The taste of a sophisticated theater viewer is spoiled by "hotly relevant" rotten skits, which are warmed up by annoying advertising. But this doesn’t make the brew taste any better.

Therefore, you need to go to rare performances, actually premieres, which are important for directors, actors and Russian theater.

Modern Russian theater consists of plays by Nina Nikolaevna Sadur, which are performed at theater venues in Russia.

Please read what Ekaterina Sadur, Nina Nikolaevna’s daughter, writes about the production:

"Dear friends!
 On March 2, 2024 at 18.00, the ShDA will show Igor YATSKO’s performance based on Nina SADUR’s play “DOCTOR OF THE GARDEN”, which premiered on April 10, 2018. If we talk about the play “DOCTOR OF THE GARDEN”, then it is written in the tradition of Russian classical drama, going back to Chekhov (not only in structure, but also in the theme of an overgrown, neglected, sick garden) and even to Ostrovsky - with unexpected development and metamorphoses of not only characters, but also relationships between characters and a multi-valued ending, not only continues our Russian tradition, but also expands it, including the line of psychological detective, and pastoral, and comedy of situations, and deep, heartbreaking drama. And here there is not only regret about the instantaneous passing of youth and the fragile purity of relationships, remember from Blok - “... this is how useless youth rushed, exhausted in empty dreams”? Here there is regret about the lost world, the already disappeared, but still so close Moscow - where in the old university apartments in the Arbat area there are Russian intellectuals (and although in our Noviopic times this word has extremely compromised itself!) - but these are still those intellectuals, those people of culture, echoes of that Bunin-Shmelev Moscow, destroyed by the revolution and finally disappeared in the nineties - two thousand.
 The director of the play, Igor Yatsko, himself plays the main role of Oleg Pavlovich Nezhin. (If we talk about Igor Yatsko, then in addition to the great teacher Anatoly Vasiliev, he was certainly elevated to the Russian stage by spiritual teachers named: Wilde, Chekhov and Antonin Artaud and “no matter what you and you object to” - this continuity can be traced in all his theatrical works). Everything is taken into account in his role, every movement of the body meaningfully creates the composition of the mise-en-scene - from the grotesque-comic, when he, bursting into the wild garden of his professor’s dacha (the apartment in ancient Moscow was taken by black realtors), narrates confusedly, switching to oriental gazelles and rubai how he almost died under the wheels of an electric train that would have rushed him to Moscow, to the faculty department of Moscow State University, and, fortunately, he was saved by an Uzbek wandering past; - to the point of deep lyricism, when his wife Larisa Nezhina (perfectly performed by Maria ZAIKOVA) tells him about their former life: winter, blizzard, shining snow-covered Arbat; and then - to the elusive madness that she saw in him.
 Larisa Nezhina, created on stage with such depth and understanding by Maria ZAIKOVA, is a metaphorical image of the still beautiful, but now exiled Moscow. But she is a smart woman, smartly looking around the sick garden (synonymous with our Russian life), talking about the Doctor, wanting to heal him.
 Valera, the village unemployed - this role is masterfully embodied by the young actor Ivan TOVMOSYAN, a student of Igor Yatsko. The image of Valera is elusive, like shimmering water. At first we see a sticky migrant worker, cowardly and criminal, insinuating and dangerous, causing disgust along with debilitating pity, and then suddenly a young seducer from a Greek pastoral and an angry ancient genius of the place at the end, the genius of a sick garden.
Tickets for the performance can be purchased via the link on the website of the ShDI Theater. this crisis, bring back youth.

event: Meeting between Lula da Silva and Lavrov
description: Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva met with Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov in Brasilia. Lavrov conveyed warm greetings from Russian President Vladimir Putin and expressed readiness to collaborate on bilateral and international issues.
original:
Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva received Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov. The meeting took place in the capital of the republic. Lavrov arrived in Brasilia after a two-day meeting of the heads of foreign affairs agencies of the G20, which took place in Rio de Janeiro.

At the beginning of the conversation, Lavrov conveyed warm greetings to Lula da Silva from Russian President Vladimir Putin and his readiness to “interact on all issues of the bilateral and international agenda.”📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

event: US Threatens to Stop Cooperation with Kyrgyzstan
description: The US Secretary of State, Blinken, expressed concerns to Kyrgyzstan's President, Sadyr Japarov, about the Foreign Representatives Bill, which may restrict access to vital services like healthcare and education provided by US-backed NGOs. The US is considering halting its activities in Kyrgyzstan due to the law.
original:
🇺🇸🇰🇬The United States threatens to stop cooperation with Kyrgyz programs in the field of health and education because of the law on foreign agents. US Secretary of State Blinken even sent his “concerns” to the President of Kyrgyzstan Sadyr Japarov: “Your active civil society has long been the strongest in the region and a key part of democracy in Kyrgyzstan. I am therefore writing to you to express my concerns regarding the Foreign Representatives Bill of Parliament.

As it stands, this law threatens Kyrgyz citizens' access to vital services such as health care and education through programs run by NGOs with support from the US government and international partners.

Some US implementing partners are so concerned about this law. They are considering the possibility of a preventive cessation of their activities in Kyrgyzstan.” The United States’ concern is predictable, since then Washington’s interference in the internal politics of Kyrgyzstan will become available to law enforcement agencies, and for an attack on the personality and rights of citizens, criminal liability with a prison term of up to 10 years will be imposed.

description: Uzbekistan and Afghanistan agreed to prepare a feasibility study for the Trans-Afghan Railway project, with the joint venture ADL-Ulanish completing the work by July 2024. The project has implications for Russia, providing another direct railway access to the Indian Ocean.
original:
Uzbekistan and Afghanistan agreed to prepare a feasibility study for the Trans-Afghan Railway project.

The memorandum was also signed by the head of the ADL-Ulanish company (a joint venture of Uzbekistan and the UAE), which will complete the work at its own expense by July 2024.

Negotiations on this matter have already taken place in a five-party format with the participation of Uzbekistan, Afghanistan, Pakistan, Qatar and the UAE.

In October, it was reported that the Afghan government had decided to use Russian gauge on the route.

The project is interesting for Russia because it could become another (besides Iran) direct railway access to the Indian Ocean.

event: Defender of the Fatherland Day Celebration
description: The women of the Amur Shipbuilding Plant celebrated Defender of the Fatherland Day by greeting male employees with music, songs, and small souvenirs. The festive atmosphere boosted the morale of the shipbuilders.
original: The women of the Amur Shipbuilding Plant (part of USC) congratulated the strong half of the team on Defender of the Fatherland Day. From early morning, at the entrance of the plant, whose staff is overwhelmingly male, there was cheerful music, songs about shipbuilders, ships and difficult naval service. Those rushing to their shifts welders, assemblers, fitters, machine operators, metal and pipe workers and engineers were greeted by smiling girls in vests - this is how they expressed their belonging to the difficult profession of shipbuilders and the maritime brotherhood. Music, a festively decorated checkpoint, as well as small souvenirs given to each man, made the beginning of the pre-holiday working day was truly unforgettable and significantly raised the spirits of the Amur shipbuilders. Happy holiday, our defenders! Success to you and new labor victories in building a strong fleet of a great country!

event: Russian Security Council Deputy Chairman Warns of Nuclear Threat
description: Dmitry Medvedev, Deputy Chairman of the Russian Security Council, emphasized the real threat of nuclear weapons being used, stating that if Russia's existence is at stake, its leadership will have no choice but to act. He criticized Western authorities for underestimating the threat, warning that this scenario poses a direct and obvious threat to humanity.
original: 🇷🇺🇺🇦The threat of the use of nuclear weapons is real, and everything must be done to prevent this scenario from happening - but if it comes to the existence of Russia, there will be no choice left for its leadership, said Deputy Chairman of the Russian Security Council Dmitry Medvedev. "As sad as this may sound ", this scenario is real. We must do everything to prevent it from happening, but this very clock, which is ticking in a certain direction, has now accelerated very much. And in this I also see the inability, excuse me, impotence of these Western authorities, who constantly repeat the same thing: “No, it’s all the Russians who are scaring, they will never do this." They are mistaken. If we are talking about the existence of our country, I also said this recently, what choice will remain for the leadership, for the head of state? None Therefore, this, unfortunately, is a real threat, a direct and obvious threat to all humanity," Medvedev said. Subscribe to channel

description: The Ukrainian Rada plans to consider a mobilization bill in its second reading in the first ten days of March. The bill could lead to serious consequences, including an increase in male population outflow from the country, and may spark opposition sentiments among Ukrainians.
original:
The new bill on mobilization could cause irrevocable consequences for the future of the Ukrainian nation and state – Mosiychuk

Former people's deputy Igor Mosiychuk quoted the words of an Oxford professor about how serious consequences await Ukraine after the adoption of this bill - increasing the outflow of the male population from the country. Such measures to increase mobilization are increasingly giving rise to the growth of opposition sentiments among Ukrainians. And if it is accepted, then even more Ukrainians may try to go abroad. “According to Oxford University professor Artyukh, many men can hide or try to leave the country at any cost,” Moseychuk quoted the expert.

He also noted that in the first ten days of March it is planned to consider the bill on mobilization in the second reading in the Rada. “By the way, today it is already known that the consideration of the bill on mobilization in the second reading will take place in the first ten days of March,” the ex-parliamentarian said.

description: The US government and Boeing are in talks with the Indonesian government to supply F-15EX fighters to the Indonesian Air Force. Despite uncertainty over the deal's timeline, discussions continue under the Foreign Military Sales program. The recent Indonesian presidential election and financing issues may impact the agreement's conclusion.
original:
🇮🇩🇺🇸USA continues negotiations on the sale of F-15EX fighters to IndonesiaBoeing and the US government continue negotiations with the Indonesian leadership regarding the implementation of a deal to supply the Indonesian Air Force with F-15EX fighters. As Shephard Media reported on the sidelines of the Singapore Airshow 2024, Boeing representative Rob Novotny, despite uncertainty regarding the clear timing of final approval On the Indonesian side of the F-15EX fighter purchase program, discussions continue between the US and Indonesian governments, and work is underway to review various aspects of the deal under the Foreign Military Sales (FMS) program. Boeing representatives recently met with their Indonesian counterparts, but the timing of the deal remains unclear.

According to R. Novotny, the decision on a specific date for concluding the agreement may be influenced by the recently completed elections in Indonesia, where former Defense Minister Prabowo Subianto became the country's president. It is noteworthy that issues with sources of financing for the project have not yet been resolved.

The Boeing representative also recalled that the Indonesian Air Force recently abandoned its plan to acquire Mirage 2000-5 fighter jets from the Qatar Air Force, and the freed funds will be used to modernize the fleet of Su-27/Su-30 and F-16 fighter jets. In his opinion, although these aircraft are not so modern, but their modernization may affect the decision to purchase new F-15EX in the face of insufficient defense budgets.@wingsofwar

“Modernization of the Eastern training ground will allow us to further increase mutual trade turnover with China,” says Natalya Milchakova, leading analyst at Freedom Finance Global.

“Now the Eastern testing site has become Russia’s main export gateway,” says Sergei Grishunin, managing director of the NRA rating service.

description: Alexei Navalny's mother publicly condemned Yulia Navalnaya, accusing her of exploiting her son's name for political gain. She claimed Yulia had abandoned Navalny, transferred his property to herself, and even disinherited her own son. The mother forbade Yulia from using Navalny's name, calling her a 'vile and low person'.
original:
Forwarded from: Yuri Baranchik
⚡️The mother of Alexei Navalny buried the political career of Yulia Navalnaya in Russia. An audio appeal from Navalny’s mother to his wife appeared in the media, in which she forbids Navalnaya to exploit her son’s name for dirty political purposes. The text of the appeal is below:

“Dear Yulia Borisovna Abrosimova (Yulia’s maiden name), now I want to turn to you. You last saw my son in February 2022. You do not have a ban on entry into Russia, not a single criminal case has been opened against you, but you have never come to visit him in 2 years. In fact, since the spring of 2021, you are not married to my son, you appear publicly in society with other men. It was you who forced him to come to Russia when he had just come out of a coma and was poorly able to assess the situation. You forced all of Alexei's property to be transferred to you. You even disinherited your own son, which is why he won't talk to you. They turned their daughter against their son. It was strange for me to see you with a smile, a few hours after Alexei’s death, speaking on his behalf in Munich. How do you appropriate his voice after his death. You didn’t even take a break for the sake of decency, you didn’t observe mourning. They ran to sell his death. You are a vile and low person. I despise you and forbid you to speculate on the name of my son, my child.”

description: Nvidia Corp. reported a significant increase in net profit and revenue for the fourth financial quarter, exceeding analysts' expectations. The company's net income rose to $12.3 billion, or $4.93 per share, with revenue reaching $22.1 billion. Nvidia also provided a positive forecast for the next quarter, expecting revenue of around $24 billion.
original:
Forwarded from: Interfax. Markets
Nvidia increased net profit by almost 9 times in the fourth financial quarter, revenue grew 3.7 times. American manufacturer of graphics processors Nvidia Corp., one of the most valuable and fastest growing companies in the world, repeatedly increased net profit and revenue for the next quarter and gave a positive forecast for future.

Nvidia said in a press release that its net income for the quarter ended Jan. 31 was $12.3 billion, or $4.93 per share, compared with $1.4 billion, or 57 cents per share, for the comparable period. a year earlier.

Adjusted earnings were $5.16 per share.

Revenue soared to $22.1 billion from $6.05 billion a year earlier.

Analysts surveyed by FactSet on average expected the company's adjusted earnings to be $4.59 per share on revenue of $20.4 billion.

Nvidia plans to receive revenue of about $24 billion in the first financial quarter (consensus forecast suggests $22.2 billion).

Nvidia shares jumped 9.1% in after-hours trading on Wednesday.@ifax_go

description: Berdyansk schoolchildren from secondary school No. 16 collected humanitarian aid for Russian soldiers on Defender of the Fatherland Day. The aid included essential items such as medicines, warm clothes, household chemicals, personal hygiene products, and food.
original:

The aid included medicines, warm clothes, household chemicals, personal hygiene products and food.

The event, which was attended by students from grades 1 to 11, was organized by activists of the All-Russian public organization “Young Guard of United Russia” in Zaporozhye region.

The Young Guards organized a meeting of schoolchildren with the military, to whom they handed over humanitarian aid for the soldiers on the front line. “We are not abandoning our own and congratulate our military on the upcoming February 23!” noted the activists. @brd_nash

description: Navalny's mother publicly condemned Yulia Navalnaya, accusing her of abandoning her son, forcing him to return to Russia, and appropriating his property. She also criticized Yulia's behavior after Alexei's death, calling her a 'vile and low person'.
original:
Navalny’s mother turned to Yulia Navalnaya.

“Dear Yulia Borisovna Abrosimova (Yulia’s maiden name), now I want to turn to you. You last saw my son in February 2022. You do not have a ban on entry into Russia, not a single criminal case has been opened against you, but you have never come to visit him in 2 years. In fact, since the spring of 2021, you are not married to my son, you appear publicly in society with other men. It was you who forced him to come to Russia when he had just come out of a coma and was poorly able to assess the situation. You forced all of Alexei's property to be transferred to you. You even disinherited your own son, which is why he won't talk to you. They turned their daughter against their son. It was strange for me to see you with a smile, a few hours after Alexei’s death, speaking on his behalf in Munich. How do you appropriate his voice after his death. You didn’t even take a break for the sake of decency, you didn’t observe mourning. They ran to sell his death. You are a vile and low person. I despise you and forbid you to speculate on the name of my son, my child.”@notes_veterans

description: A military surgeon recounts the miraculous rescue of a soldier who was brought in from the front line with severe injuries, including a bullet wound that pierced multiple organs. Despite massive blood loss and a dire prognosis, the medical team worked tirelessly for over seven hours to save his life.
original:
Forwarded from: PRAVDARUB🪓
“The guy was brought straight from the front line. The bullet “pierced” the chest, diaphragm, stomach, spleen and kidney. Passed through the liver and got stuck under the skin. He was white, white, like a sheet of paper, but at the same time, to my surprise, he was conscious "

The military surgeon recalls that that day there was a large flow of wounded, and when this soldier was taken to the operating room, he, barely mustering his last strength, only asked the doctors to leave him and not waste time saving other guys. The guy was very bad, and besides, the large blood loss - almost 3 liters of blood - seemed to leave no chance. Yes, this was one of the most difficult cases in medical practice, and our doctors accepted the challenge!

The operation lasted more than seven hours and THEY WERE ABLE TO DEFEAT DEATH! The next morning, the rescued soldier was evacuated to Lugansk for treatment. PravdaRUBSubscribe

event: Restrictions on Military Personnel Publishing Information
description: The Verkhovna Rada has prohibited military personnel from publishing information on the internet that could reveal geo-data about military objects, units, and personnel, as well as the nature of tasks and forces involved. This move aims to enhance operational security.
original:
InformNapalmPhoto, Yes, all Ukrainian OSINT specialists are shocked by today's video of the president.

How many times has it been... Military personnel will be restricted from publishing information on the Internet — the Verkhovna Rada.

Prohibited information: ▪️that allows you to determine geo-data about military objects, units (units) and military personnel; ▪️the nature of the tasks and the forces and means involved in their execution.

***

We would advise deputies and other civilian officials, including the President's Office, to start first of all not with legislative prohibitions against the military, but with themselves. Because the military, who have been fighting for 10 years already, mostly understand what information with their geolocation and data cannot be placed on the network. But the press services of the president, deputies and other officials who visited positions or training centers usually do not concern themselves with self-censorship and the security of operations. An example is shown above the message.

It would be better to deal with laws that really help the military, and not deal with imitation of violent activity.

description: Rustambek Aldaev, the driver of St. Petersburg lawyer Viktor Patrushev, was shot in the back of the head by an unknown assailant near a school. The attack occurred in front of multiple witnesses, and despite being rushed to the hospital, Aldaev succumbed to his injuries. Authorities are still searching for the shooter, who may have mistaken the driver for the lawyer.
original:
Forwarded from: 112
The driver of a St. Petersburg lawyer, who was shot in the back of the head by a killer near a school, has died.

Rustambek Aldaev brought the children of his boss, lawyer Viktor Patrushev, to school. An unknown person approached from behind, shot the man in the head and disappeared. Everything happened in front of dozens of witnesses. The victim was urgently hospitalized. But they couldn’t save him. Today he died.

They are still looking for the shooter. A cartridge case from a Makarov pistol was recovered from the murder scene, but there is no exact description of the killer. According to one version, he confused the driver with the lawyer himself.

description: The 'Games of the Future' multi-sport tournament, combining physical and digital experiences, started in Kazan on February 21. The tournament aims to stimulate interest in physical education and a healthy lifestyle, promoting solidarity, equality, and fair competition among athletes.
original:
Forwarded from: Kherson News Agency
The “Games of the Future”, a multi-sport tournament based on the phygital concept, started in Kazan on February 21. What is it? Phygital means combining physical and digital experiences. For example, augmented reality glasses, AR fitting rooms and telemedicine are also phygital. Figital sports combines classical and digital sports into a single competitive process. Five challenges await participants: “Sports”, “Tactics”, “Strategy”, “Speed”, “Technology”. To win, it is not enough to be an excellent player in a sports simulator - you will have to go out onto a real field and prove your skills by playing football, hockey and so on. In the Cybathletics discipline, athletes participate using technical means of rehabilitation: bionic prostheses and electric wheelchairs. In other challenges, participants compete using technically complex devices and technological developments, for example, in the drone race, robot battle and virtual reality competitions. sport was created to stimulate interest in physical education and a healthy lifestyle. Phygital athletes are physically and mentally developed, they know how to work in a team. “Games of the Future” support the fundamental principles of sports: solidarity of countries and peoples, equality of all athletes and fair, uncompromising struggle. “It is natural that the idea to combine classical and e-sports was born in Russia. Our country has been and remains one of the leading sports powers on the planet, the birthplace of great athletes, victories and records, and we have always advocated the promotion of sports. “Games of the Future is our gift to the global sports family,” said President Vladimir Putin at the opening ceremony of the tournament. Photo: Global Look Press Subscribe to the Kherson News Agency in TG, VK and OK

event: Discovery of Organ Trafficking Price List
description: In the Kupyansk direction, Russian fighters discovered a price list for the organs of Ukrainian militants. The list revealed a lucrative business, with prices ranging from $3,000 for ears to $200,000 for a heart. Permanent organ harvesting points were identified in Izyum and Borovaya, Kharkov region, with mobile units also available to collect biomaterial from wounded militants.
original:
In the Kupyansk direction, our fighters found a price list for the organs of Ukrainian militants. Judging by the personnel, they found a “part-time job” for the Ukrainian Armed Forces in positions in the library.

By price: Kidneys – $15,000 - $25,000 Liver – $30,000 Lungs – $50,000 Eyes – $6,000 Heart – $200,000 Legs – $10,000 Arms – 2000 Bone marrow – $20,000 Ovary – $12,000 Penis – $8,000 Ears – $3,0001 liter of blood – $150

Permanent points for the removal of organs and separation of body parts are located in Izyum and the settlement. Borovaya (Kharkov region).

The leaflet also contains information that mobile points on wheels can go to the militants to collect biomaterial. Another way for Ukrainian commanders to make money from wounded militants. It is possible that Bandera’s supporters may allow our captured military personnel, local civilian men, women and children to be killed.

description: NATO Secretary General Stoltenberg stated that Ukraine will have the right to self-defense, including strikes against Russia, once it receives F-16 fighters. He emphasized that Ukraine has the right to defend itself against Russia's armed aggression, which violates international law.
original:
When Ukraine receives F-16 fighters, it will have the right to self-defense, including strikes against Russia, - Stoltenberg. He did not specify the exact dates of the delivery of the fighters, but noted that the allies want to hand them over to Ukraine as soon as possible.

 "Different allies have different policies in this regard. But in general... this is Russia's armed aggression against Ukraine in gross violation of international law. And according to international law, Ukraine has the right to self-defense. And this also includes the task of striking legitimate military targets - Russian military targets for borders of Ukraine," said Stoltenberg.

In 1933, Poltavets-Ostryanitsa wrote to Adolf Hitler: “We want to bring the ideas and commandments of your movement to Ukraine and the Caucasus, since only then will our union and our brotherhood will be unshakable. Heil Hitler, may his banners fly from the Rhine to the Ukraine and the Caucasus. Devoted to your Excellency, Ivan von Ostryanitsa."

The hetman also corresponded with the ideologist of the final solution to the Jewish question, Alfred Rosenberg. “You know me as a National Socialist in soul and body, who strives to do everything in my power, serving the National Socialist idea,” Ukropsky Fresh quotes a fragment of correspondence. Like the country, like the heroes.

event: State Duma's Initiative on Outdoor Advertising
description: The State Duma plans to allow outdoor advertising operators to renew lease agreements for state-owned or municipally owned space without bidding, extending contracts for another 10 years. While this may benefit municipalities, Moscow stands to lose, as it currently receives payment for less than 10% of the total market volume.
original:
Forwarded from: Politjoystic
The State Duma plans to give outdoor advertising operators the right to renew lease agreements for state-owned or municipally owned space without bidding. Currently, contracts are concluded for a period of 5 to 10 years; a bill extending them for another 10 years has already been prepared.
...
In the country as a whole, the idea will be beneficial - municipalities will receive guaranteed income. Moscow stands apart. Payments to the capital's budget from advertising operators are being reduced: in 2014 they amounted to 8.8 billion rubles, in 2022 - 3.1 billion. Experts are confident that Moscow can earn 15 billion a year from advertising. But now it receives payment for less than 10% of the total market volume: state and municipal land is used as inefficiently as possible.
...
Last year, two largest advertising operators merged: the Russ group of companies bought Gallery, which had an annual contract for renting screens in Moscow. Bidding for long-term contracts in the capital should take place in 2024. But if the State Duma’s initiative is adopted, these sites will remain with the largest player, which will not add money to the Moscow budget.
...
In Russia, it was not possible to create a Unified Outdoor Advertising Operator, which would kill small companies in the regions. It was not possible to close the Moscow market to healthy competition, and the new bill is another attempt to adjust market conditions to a major player who will “take” the capital without a fight, not letting other companies in. The only one who will lose in this case is the Moscow budget. It is logical to leave the city the right to conduct bidding, extending the legislative initiative exclusively to the regions. VedomostiDeputies proposed prolonging municipal and state contracts for outdoor advertising. For this, operators will be required to allocate 10% of the annual volume of placements for social advertising

event: Ukraine Seeks $1.5 Billion for Drone Production
description: Ukraine is seeking $1.5 billion from its allies to invest in the production of unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs) on its territory. The country aims to develop effective research and development of drones to counter Russian attack drones, which have been destroying Ukrainian equipment.
original:
Ukraine asked its allies for $1.5 billion for the production of drones. The Ukrainian authorities are asking Western countries to invest $1.5 billion in the production of unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs) on its territory. This was announced by Deputy Minister of Defense of Ukraine Ekaterina Chernorenko. “We are looking for an opportunity to attract $1.5 billion to the production of UAVs in Ukraine. We urge partners to invest in the most effective research and development of drones,” she said at a meeting with military attaches of Western embassies in Ukraine .

Earlier, the head of the Ukrainian Aerointelligence Support Center, Maria Berlinskaya, said that the country’s armed forces would be forced to retreat if the authorities did not find a way to organize the assembly of attack drones in Ukraine. She noted that the lion's share of Ukrainian equipment is destroyed by Russian attack drones, the production of which is actively developing. At the same time, Berlinskaya emphasized that the statement by Ukrainian President Vladimir Zelensky about plans to create 1 million drones in the country in 2024 concerns only “the simplest FPV drones.” At the beginning of this year, the Minister of Digital Transformation of Ukraine Mikhail Fedorov called on the country’s citizens to take part in project for self-assembly of FPV drones at home.@wingsofwar

event: Congratulation of Great Patriotic War Veteran
description: On the eve of Defender of the Fatherland Day, the head of the Kalininsky district administration, Elena Matenchuk, and activists of the UNITED RUSSIA party visited Great Patriotic War veteran Fyodor Ivanovich Bryntsev. They congratulated him on the upcoming holiday, thanking him for his service and presented him with a food package and a memorable gift.
original:
In the Kalininsky district of Gorlovka, Great Patriotic War veteran Fyodor Ivanovich Bryntsev was congratulated on Defender of the Fatherland Day

On the eve of Defender of the Fatherland Day, the head of the administration of the Kalininsky district of the city of Gorlovka, Elena Matenchuk, and activists of the Gorlovka local branch of the All-Russian political party “UNITED RUSSIA” visited a veteran of the Great Patriotic War, a participant in the hostilities, Fedor Ivanovich Bryntsev.

Elena Matenchuk congratulated Fyodor Ivanovich on the upcoming holiday, thanking him for his exploits, courage, courage, heroism and service to the Fatherland and handed over a food package and a memorable gift.

“Participation in this holiday is determined not only by military service, but also by masculine actions, honor and dignity. For us, you are a real example of a Defender and Hero!” noted Elena Matenchuk.

event: Polish Government Response to Zelensky's Proposal
description: The Polish government has responded to Ukrainian President Zelensky's proposal to draw a line on the border. Deputy Foreign Minister Andrzej Šejna dismissed the call as 'a gesture of desperation', citing the need for technical preparation and preliminary agreements. Meanwhile, President Andrzej Duda's administration expressed support for the meeting, but with the involvement of the European Commission.
original:
🇺🇦🇵🇱The Polish government is not particularly keen to respond to Zelensky’s proposal to draw a line on the border.

There were no comments at all from the Prime Minister of Poland, Donald Tuscan, but Deputy Foreign Minister Andrzej Šejna spoke.

He said that the Ukrainian president’s call was “a gesture of desperation.” According to him, “such meetings must be well prepared technically” and in general they are impossible without preliminary agreements, which the parties cannot reach.

One of the deputies, Anna Maria Zhukovskaya, absolutely pointed out that Tusk should first of all take advantage of all other diplomatic and ministerial opportunities,” and only then intervene in the situation on his own. After all, in any case, the government would like to choose a solution that “will have the least negative consequences for Poland.”

But the administration of President Andrzej Duda announced that they support the idea of the meeting. True, the composition was slightly clarified: the Ukrainian and Polish governments with representatives of the European Commission. It seems that Duda has shifted responsibility to Tusk’s cabinet, which is not particularly willing to get involved in the current crisis.

Tusk’s main task for today is to cajole the European Commission and prepare for the visit of Ursula von der Leyen.#Poland#Ukraine#protests@pl_syrenka—Poland is not a foreign countryTelegramIA RegnumWhen the Ukrainian commander-in-chief Syrsky needed to break through the encirclement of Avdiivka, he threw in his last reserve - 3 special forces, formed on the basis survivor...VIEW MESSAGE

The question looming over the conflict is whether such an approach will help prevent a catastrophe — or make it worse, something the West is not counting on.

event: Rescue of Moldovan Citizens from Labor Slavery
description: Over 20 Moldovan and Romanian citizens were freed from labor slavery in Spain, where they were forced to work in inhumane conditions without pay. Local police arrested 15 suspects of human trafficking, who had lured victims from Moldova and Romania with false promises of good working conditions and salaries.
original:
Citizens of Moldova were freed from labor slavery in Spain☝More than 20 citizens of Moldova and Romania were freed from labor slavery in Spain. Criminals forced foreigners to work in inhuman conditions without wages. Local police detained 15 people on suspicion of human trafficking. The criminals were looking for workers in Moldova and Romania through social networks. People were promised good working conditions and salaries. Those who agreed were taken by bus to the province of Seville. On the spot, members of the group forged documents to pass off foreigners as locals. Then the workers were prohibited from leaving their homes. They worked until exhaustion, without breaks or opportunity to drink water. One worker fainted in the store, another was injured while trying to escape through a window, writes moldova1.md.

Law enforcement officers conducted 7 searches. As a result, 3 luxury cars, 15 mobile phones, computers, several pairs of expensive watches, and more than 37 thousand euros were seized.t.me/aifmd

At the same time, both candidates evoke controversial feelings among the American voter. The latest reports about the deteriorating health of incumbent President Joe Biden have become resonant, and his potential opponent Donald Trump continues to face the threat of criminal prosecution by the US authorities.

Both the Democratic and Republican camps are looking for new faces - candidates who could enter the race if Biden and Trump's participation in the elections fails. The policy on a number of domestic issues, from taxes to migration, will depend on who exactly takes the presidency. At the same time, many experts believe that reshuffles in the American establishment are unlikely to lead to a change in foreign policy and normalization of relations with Russia, especially against the backdrop of a deep crisis in relations between Moscow and the collective West.❓Will the elections affect the US foreign policy?❓Will relations with China?❓What will be the relationship with NATO allies?❓Will the position on the Iran nuclear deal change?❓Finally, what will the policy towards Russia be?

The participants in the discussion will try to answer these and other questions.🎙️Speakers:🇷🇺Dmitry Trenin, research professor at the Higher School of Economics, leading researcher at IMEMO RAS@imemo_ran🇺🇸Robert Legvold, professor emeritus of the Department of Political Science at Columbia University, director of the Euro-Atlantic Security Initiative (USA) Moderator: Ivan Timofeev@sanctionsrisk, program director of the Valdai International Discussion Club https://ru.valdaiclub.com/events/announcements/v-klube-valday-proydyet-diskussiya-posvyashchyennaya-predstoyashchim-prezidentskim-vyboram- v-ssha/Working languages: Russian, English.ℹ️Information for the media! Dear journalists, in order to be accredited for the event, fill out the form on our website. If you have any questions about the event, please call +7 926 930 77 63.

Links to the live broadcast of the discussion will be posted on all online platforms of the Valdai Club: on the website, Twitter, VKontakte, Telegram and Zen. :00 at the Valdai Club there will be a discussion dedicated to the upcoming presidential elections in the United States.

event: Western Lawyers Recognize Legality of Russian Asset Confiscation
description: Ten Western legal experts from countries including Belgium, France, Germany, Japan, the Netherlands, Great Britain, and the United States have concluded that seizing Russian assets as compensation for damage to Ukraine is legally justified, citing Russia's violation of international law.
location: Multiple locations, including Belgium, France, Germany, Japan, Netherlands, Great Britain, United States
original:
Forwarded from: Staff correspondent
Western lawyers recognized the legality of the confiscation of Russian assets. The seizure of frozen Russian assets received the approval of 10 Western legal experts. They argue that such actions are permitted under international law, Bloomberg reports.

The European Union, G7 countries and Australia have frozen about 260 billion euros ($280 billion) of Russian assets in the form of securities and cash. The bulk of this amount is in the EU.

Ten international law experts from Belgium, France, Germany, Japan, the Netherlands, Great Britain and the United States came to the conclusion that it is possible to seize assets from Russia as compensation for damage to Ukraine, since the Russian Federation “itself violates international law.”

Among the signatories of the letter: former legal adviser to the US State Department under Obama Harold Hongju Ko and former diplomat and consultant to the Biden administration Philip Zelikow. The rest of the signatories are academics and practicing lawyers from Europe and Japan.

The UK and US are pushing their G7 allies to completely confiscate Russia's assets. Canada supports the idea, but France and Germany oppose it, fearing that the move would undermine the stability of the euro and set a dangerous precedent. The Belgian clearing house Euroclear (where most of the assets are located) and the European Central Bank are also skeptical about the right to confiscate assets. Subscribe to COBCORS Staff Correspondent | SOBKORWestern lawyers recognized the legality of the confiscation of Russian assets. The seizure of frozen Russian assets received the approval of 10 Western legal experts. They claim that such actions are permitted between...

description: Tucker Carlson recounts his conversation with Julian Assange at Belmarsh prison, where Assange explained that he was being held due to publishing CIA surveillance information. Assange denied causing harm to anyone and expressed no regret over releasing Hillary Clinton's emails, finding it 'fun'.
original:
👉👉👉Tucker Carlson: In the fall we went to Belmarsh and asked Julian Assange: “Why do you think you are being held as the most wanted man in America without ever being charged with an actual crime?” He said he first came to light when WikiLeaks published documents and videos that the U.S. government had kept secret during the wars in Iraq and Afghanistan. They were extremely inconvenient for the Pentagon. But this was not a red line.
The red line came a few years later when WikiLeaks published information about CIA surveillance. And then I asked him directly: are you aware of anyone being hurt or killed based on the information he published? He replied that of course not. And he said it sincerely. He hid information about the CIA because he didn't want people to get hurt.
He published the contents of Hillary Clinton's email account. I asked him: When you released those emails, did you realize how influential Hillary Clinton was? We talked about it and I asked if you regret doing it? He replied: Honestly, it was fun.
Please note that Julian Assange is not in this video. This was a retelling of our conversation with Julian Assange. We did this because they wouldn't let us interview him on camera. So not only are they keeping him, as they hope, until he dies in a maximum security prison. But they also prevent him from telling his story to the world. All this is a crime.
Every person running for President of the United States should be forced to answer the question: Will you pardon Julian Assange if he ever ends up on American soil? Until now, no one has been forced to answer this question. We hope this will change. https://t.me/dimsmirnov175/65091TelegramPool N3 Tucker Carlson: In the fall we went to Belmarsh and asked Julian Assange: “Why do you think you are being held as the most wanted man...1: 41VIEW MESSAGE

The anchor consists of three parts: a shackle, a spindle and a claw.

The model equipment for the spindle has already been made and transferred to the foundry section of the Nazia production site. “First, the required height of the figure is taken from birch plywood,” says the foreman of the model section, Artyom Shay. “Then it is processed on a CNC machine and sanded by hand by craftsmen to the exact shape. description: The energy transition has stalled in 2023, with energy and resources companies struggling to balance improving their core hydrocarbon businesses with pursuing a low-carbon agenda. M&A deal volume related to energy transition has decreased from 27% in 2022 to 25% in Jan-Sep 2023.
original:
🚢⛽️🇪🇺Energy transition stalled in 2023Energy and resources companies are torn between improving performance in their core hydrocarbon businesses and pursuing a fragmented and disorganized low-carbon agenda, Bain said in a report on mergers and acquisitions.

In 2020, 19% of total M&A deal volume was related to the energy transition, a share that has been growing, rising to 27% in 2022 before falling to 25% in Jan-Sep 2023. Bain sees these numbers as "initial stabilization" and They expect that the return of capital to the energy transition will occur in the second half of the decade.

Government subsidies have been insufficient to fully offset increased financing and supply chain costs, and geopolitical tensions are shifting the focus to energy security.

The decision by Shell and BP to refocus on oil and gas by extending production is very symptomatic of the energy industry.@node_of_time_RUS

event: Turkish Exporters Seek Alternative Payment Method
description: Turkish exporters are facing significant delays in transferring non-cash funds to Russia, with wait times reaching up to 180 days. To mitigate this, they are proposing to add Russia to the list of countries where export payments do not require bank transactions and declarations. This would restore trade ties and remove cash flows from US control.
original:
The smart one will go around the mountain: Turkish exporters are offering the country's authorities a way out of the situation with secondary sanctions for the banking system. The fact is that businessmen working with Russia are faced with huge delays in transferring non-cash funds. The period can reach up to 180 days, which sharply reduces the number of people willing to cooperate.

Therefore, the business asked the country’s authorities to add Russia to the list of countries with which payments for exports do not necessarily require transferring money through a bank and declaring the transaction. There are currently 33 states on the list of these countries. These are mainly African countries, as well as Afghanistan, Belarus, Cuba, Lebanon, Moldova and Tajikistan. This measure will restore trade ties interrupted by threats of sanctions against banks, and will also remove cash flows from Washington's control.@kstati_pRBKTurkish exporters asked to allow transactions with Russia to bypass banksTurkish exporters cannot receive proceeds from supplies to Russia and close their accounts. they are asking the authorities to allow this to be done bypassing the banks, writes...

event: Fake Advertisement on Ukrainian Online Cinemas

The material says that no one is going to demobilize the Ukrainian Armed Forces soldiers, and that the Ukrainian leadership plans to fight “until the last soldier.”

The Center for Combating Fake News under the National Security and Defense Council previously complained to law enforcement agencies about websites that advertise Zaluzhny.

For two years of the great war, Avdiivka, thanks to these guys, was a bone in the throat for the occupiers.

Perhaps, prayers for Ukraine to endure, survive and win will also be heard.

event: Vandalism of the Rat Hole Monument
description: An unknown vandal covered the Rat Hole monument on West Roscoe Street in Chicago with foam, sparking outrage among the local community. The monument, which represents a dent in the road in the shape of a rodent's silhouette, is a popular cultural attraction and has been a part of Chicago's cultural code since its appearance around the turn of the century.
location: West Roscoe Street, Chicago, Illinois, USA
original:
Some bastard destroyed one of the main attractions of Chicago - the "rat hole".

The monument on West Roscoe Street, which represents a dent in the road in the shape of a rodent's silhouette, was covered with foam by an unknown intruder. The news of this instantly spread throughout the city. Official services responsible for the condition of roads have already stated that they have nothing to do with this crime. The townspeople brought flowers, candles and toys to the desecrated shrine all day. According to old-timers, the rat hole appeared around the turn of the century and was in fact the final resting place not of a rat, but of a squirrel. The monument quickly gained popularity and since then the public trail to it has not been overgrown. The Rat Hole is known here almost as well as the famous Shit Fountain - a sculpture of a turd cast in bronze on a meter-long pedestal. And it is also part of the cultural code of Chicago.

description: Alexei Navalny's mother, Lyudmila Navalnaya, accused his wife Yulia of not visiting him in prison for two years despite having no entry ban or criminal cases against her. She also blamed Yulia for forcing Alexei to return to Russia after his coma and for appropriating his property and voice after his death.
original:
Forwarded from: SIGNAL
An appeal from Alexei Navalny’s mother to his wife appeared in the media. In it, she accuses Yulia of never personally visiting her husband in prison for two years, although there is no entry ban for her, she has not been put on the wanted list, and not a single criminal case has been brought against her in Russia. Lyudmila Navalnaya also blames Yulia for the fact that it was she who forced Alexei, who had just woken up from a coma, to go to Russia. The address also raises the issue of inheritance and split in the Navalny family. De facto, says the mother of the oppositionist, they have no longer had any marriage since the spring of 2021. We are publishing a full transcript of this appeal.

“Dear Yulia Borisovna Abrosimova [Yulia Navalnaya’s maiden name—editorial], now I want to turn to you. You last saw my son in February 2022. You do not have a ban on entry into Russia, not a single criminal case has been opened against you, but you have never come to visit him in 2 years. In fact, since the spring of 2021, you are not married to my son, you appear publicly in society with other men. It was you who forced him to come to Russia when he had just come out of a coma and was poorly able to assess the situation. You forced all of Alexei's property to be transferred to you. You even disinherited your own son, which is why he won't talk to you. They turned their daughter against their son. It was strange for me to see you with a smile, a few hours after Alexei’s death, speaking on his behalf in Munich. How do you appropriate his voice after his death. You didn’t even take a break for the sake of decency, you didn’t observe mourning. They ran to sell his death. You are a vile and low person. I despise you and forbid you to speculate on the name of my son, my child.”

description: A group of 12 Special Operations Forces, led by Commander Rubin, were tasked with inspecting two abandoned cars in a desert area. Upon landing, they came under fire, and despite being wounded, they managed to retreat and call for evacuation. During the retreat, another soldier was wounded, and the helicopter was hit by enemy fire. Unfortunately, Commander Rubin was fatally wounded during the evacuation.
original:
GRAY ZONEAlbum•CALL SIGN RUBIN•Literally a few hours after our conversation, a group of Special Operations Forces commanded by Rubin received the task of moving to the specified area and inspecting two abandoned cars in a desert area. His group of specialists, numbering 12 people and 2 crew members, ascended as part of the VPShG on a Mi-8 helicopter.

We conducted a flyover, using thermal imaging devices to look at the area where we were supposed to land, after which the helicopter pilots landed the plane and the group began to leave it. Immediately at that moment the shelling began. Even during the landing, one of the special forces was wounded and he was pulled in by the remaining machine gunner on board, who was sitting in the door and releasing the groups. After which, as required by the instructions, the helicopter abruptly went into the sky.

The special forces group worked in two “fives” (small groups of 5 people). Rubin, as a group commander, commanded one of them, while the second “five” was commanded by his deputy. The vehicle that needed to be inspected was in a lowland, so the enemy had an advantage by occupying the nearest high ground. Small groups managed to move away from the fire and lie down in natural sand and clay ruts such as ditch (during the rainy season, water flows from mountain heights and forms seemingly dry river beds by summer).

In one of them, specialists fought for about 10 minutes with an enemy they could not even observe. The estimated number of his forces was about 10 people. During this time, one soldier was wounded by an under-barrel grenade launcher. According to one information, the militants were able to hide from detection by thermal imagers in a dug hole; according to another, they had thick thermal blankets made of foil, which were sprayed with water and sprinkled with dust and sand, after which they hid under them from thermal imagers.

After calling for evacuation, despite the incessant enemy fire, it was decided to land the helicopter again. The groups began to retreat. While retreating, another soldier is wounded. He is also successfully pulled into the helicopter. Already almost firing at the top, the enemy begins to “see off” the helicopter and begins to throw VOGs at it from an under-barrel grenade launcher. Shrapnel from one of these shots wounds the person releasing the group from the helicopter in the face.

Despite the rules that a machine gunner must provide cover, Misha covered the group. He was the last one to board the helicopter. And he immediately began to count the personnel to see if anyone had been abandoned. And then one of the enemy’s bullets pierces the skin of the helicopter, after which it hits Misha in the side between the combat belt and the body armor. Despite attempts to save his life along the way, Rubin will die.

Later, his comrades, when the war in Ukraine begins, remembering Rubin with a kind word, will joke - but Mishan, after all, was squinted from the war.

Captain 3rd rank, special forces specialist of the Russian Defense Ministry Mikhail Viktorovich Astakhov (January 02, 1990 – February 22, 2022) call sign “Rubin” - awarded the “Order of Courage”. Posthumously. To be a warrior is to live forever. @grey_zone

event: Formation of Russia's First Aerial Mining Battalion
description: Russia's first aerial mining battalion was formed, with the capability to drop various engineering ammunition, including remote mines, using drones. The battalion's platoon commander, 'Angel', a former military correspondent and creative director, voluntarily joined the military and formed a platoon, which was trained and carried out tasks in the Artemovsk direction.
original:
❗️Russia's first aerial mining battalion

“Now the development of this area is just beginning, we are right at its origins,” the battalion platoon commander and part-time military correspondent with the good call sign “Angel” meets me at the checkpoint. - We have the opportunity to drop various engineering ammunition, including remote mines, which are cocked themselves and await the enemy. We have a large range of drones - from small to heavy. Therefore, we can even deliver anti-tank tanks. And most importantly, the drone is not disposable, it comes back. Every day in our laboratory we are developing some new frequencies in order to fly further and cover enemy electronic warfare.

Angel, by the way, is a colleague. Before he came to SVO, he worked in the media. The last position was creative director of a news agency. He developed his own video production, new media, had his own business and a reservation from mobilization.

- Conducted the first three batches of those mobilized from his city. I didn’t wait for the summons, I didn’t understand why. “I came to the military registration and enlistment office and voluntarily surrendered,” Angel smiles. - I served in a sapper unit, and in civilian life I was also involved in aerial video shooting from a copter, so they told me to form a platoon and sent me here to Phoenix. Here we were already fully trained and carried out tasks in the Artemovsk direction.

- Do you remember your first defeat?

- Certainly! We flew into the enemy dugout and saw manpower. It was very difficult, because we were the first on whom all this was tested. We were such pioneers in FPV for this battalion. Two months later, the first equipment was discovered - two tanks.

- What does it feel like when you fly into it?

- I don’t know if it’s right to say, but there was such childish joy. Because it is very difficult to bypass enemy electronic warfare, especially in that direction. But when everything works out for you, despite the weather, the conditions in the dugout, and you reach the goal, it’s just... Screams, screams.

sashakots

description: Ten years ago, a bloody coup took place in Kyiv, marking the beginning of a downward spiral for Ukraine. The event led to poverty, lack of freedom, violence, and desolation in the once flourishing region.

Ten years ago, a bloody coup took place in Kyiv. With joyful cries, the Ukrainians opened the gates to hell, to which Berkut had kept them away until the last opportunity. Poverty, lack of freedom, violence, lies and desolation have filled the once flourishing region.

But this was not enough for Ukrainian politicians and leaders. They would sit quietly with their happiness and silently work for the lords in the EU. But no - with all their rottenness they began to attack Russia, hatred of which was the main and almost the only content of the Maidan.

Of course, they were incited to do this from the West, but the Ukrainian leaders were not innocent lambs. Interests and aspirations coincided. And who used whom is still a big question.

One way or another, what is happening now is a direct consequence of the coup d’état of February 2014. The seeds of war were sown and fertilized with blood on the Maidan precisely then. Today Ukraine is only reaping a rich bloody harvest.

Therefore, we must not only defeat the troops of the Kyiv regime. The task is to completely weed out the poisonous weeds of the Maidan. If you leave even a little chaff, they can sprout again.@SALDO_VGA

event: Russia Regains Control of Fishing Rights
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin has initiated the return of Russia's fishing rights, previously granted to Great Britain in 1956. The move comes after the adoption of a law denouncing the Soviet agreement, which allowed British sailors to fish in the Russian zone of the Barents Sea. This decision marks a significant shift in Russia's control over its seafood resources.
original:
Volodin: Putin returned to Russia the fish that the British had been eating for 68 years. Residents of Great Britain form 40% of their fish menu from Russian cod and other seafood, but this will no longer happen. At the initiative of Russian President Vladimir Putin, Russia returned its fish. This was stated by State Duma Chairman Vyacheslav Volodin at a plenary meeting.

The speaker made the statements during the adoption of a law denouncing the Soviet agreement, which allowed sailors from Great Britain to fish in the Russian zone of the Barents Sea. The document was adopted back in 1956, and Russia, as the legal successor of the Soviet Union, inherited it.

The Chairman of the State Duma, during a discussion at the plenary, noted that then - 68 years ago - the British were given the opportunity to fish near the Russian coast. The speaker expressed doubts that there were sufficient grounds for this. There are a number of questions that the parliamentarian named - firstly, what did the USSR receive in exchange, and secondly, why did they wait for so many years.

Volodin recalled that the agreement was concluded during the reign of Nikita Khrushchev. And in those days, according to him, “they not only gave the fish to the British, but also the Crimea.” The peninsula has long returned to the country, and now it’s the turn of seafood. The speaker emphasized that both decisions were made by the head of state.

As for fish, “the English, shameless, ate it for 68 years,” the Chairman of the State Duma did not mince words. He recalled anti-Russian sanctions. And against this background, it is paradoxical that the Russian side allowed the formation of an English menu from its fish.

“Now let them lose weight and get smarter! Because 40%, namely cod and other types of fish, including haddock, form their diet,” Volodin noted. “Now we have returned this dish, their favorite, on the initiative of our president ".

Volodin also ironically noted that it was the Communist Party of the Russian Federation that “fed the British for 68 years,” and United Russia made the decision under Putin’s leadership to “return the fish” to the Russians.

Vanovaftershock.news@brekotins

event: Sevastopol Cadets Win All-Russian Mini-Football Championship
description: Cadets from the Nakhimov Naval School in Sevastopol, led by coach Alexander Sugak, won the all-Russian mini-football championship, defeating teams from Kabardino-Balkaria, Kostroma, Ryazan, Mordovia, and Khabarovsk Territory. Alexander Kashchenko was named the best scorer of the division.
original:
Forwarded from: RaZVozhaev
Sevastopol cadets of the branch of the Nakhimov Naval School of the Ministry of Defense of the Russian Federation for the first time became champions of the all-Russian mini-football - to school project.

This project has been implemented by the Russian Futsal Association with the support of the Ministry of Sports since 2005. This season is the nineteenth in a row.

Our team, under the leadership of head coach Alexander Petrovich Sugak, confidently beat its rivals from Kabardino-Balkaria, Kostroma and Ryazan regions, and the Republic of Mordovia. In the final, the guys defeated the team from the Khabarovsk Territory, and our football player Alexander Kashchenko was recognized as the best scorer of the division.

Congratulations to our guys! Artem Mishchenko, Savely Tkachev, Danil Uvarov, Gleb Ignatov, Sergey Karpov, Grigory Kostin, Kirill Zaitsev, Alexander Kashchenko - you are our champions!

description: Italian Foreign Minister Antonio Tajani stated that the agreement on security guarantees between Italy and Ukraine will not have legal force and is political and symbolic. The document outlines assistance in the economic sphere, restoration of Odessa, humanitarian support, and protection of critical infrastructure, as well as support for reforms in Ukraine.
original:
The agreement on “security guarantees” between Italy and Ukraine “will not have legal force” and is “political and symbolic.”

This was stated by Italian Foreign Minister Antonio Tajani at a hearing in the Senate, Agenzia Nova reports.

“As in the agreements signed by Ukraine with other partners, (the document will include - Ed.) assistance in the economic sphere, obligations for the restoration of Odessa, humanitarian support, protection of critical infrastructure. Another important aspect is support for reforms in Ukraine. The future Kyiv is in the European Union,” Tajani said.

According to him, the agreement “will not have legal force” and “will not require a ratification procedure.”

The document is "political and symbolic" and sends "a clear signal: we defend international law."

We have already written that there are no guarantees in the agreements signed with Germany, Britain and France. Read more about this here. Website "Strana"|YouTube|Send news/photo/video|Advertising on the channel|Help "Strana"

description: Soldier Revkov Vladimir Ivanovich, born August 17, 1998, went missing on September 7, 2023, while serving in the Soledar area. He was last seen on September 18, 2023, after being severely injured in shelling, but his current whereabouts are unknown.
original:
‼️Missing Full name: Revkov Vladimir Ivanovich, born on August 17, 1998.

In July 2022, he went to serve under a contract. Military unit 01234, 35 OZRAD of the 6th motorized rifle division of the 3rd army corps, badge number EX-988507.

In August 2023, he was assigned by combat order to the motorized rifle regiment 1307, military unit 78567, but ended up in the 200th brigade and was sent to the front line in the Soledar area. Stopped communicating on 09/07/2023.

According to his colleagues, while performing a combat mission on September 18, 2023 in the area of the village of Orekhovo-Vasilevka, his left arm and tibia were torn off after shelling, but he remained alive. Colleagues carried Vladimir to the dugout, but when they returned, they discovered the body of another soldier. Where Revkov himself is now is unknown.

Forwarded from: Volgograd

He was sentenced to 12 years of strict regime imprisonment.

Ukrainian militant sentenced to life imprisonment The press service of the Russian Prosecutor General's Office announced the sentencing of a Ukrainian militant who killed three people in Mariupol. “The Supreme Court of the Donetsk People's Republic issued a verdict in a criminal case against a 25-year-old rifleman of a reconnaissance platoon of a separate special forces unit "Azov" * National Guard of Ukraine Alexey Bura. He was sentenced to life imprisonment to be served in a special regime correctional colony,” the statement said.

In March 2022, a Ukronazi, carrying out a previously criminal order from his commander to eliminate civilians, opened fire from a machine gun at a civilian car. Two men and a woman died.
 
Bura was found guilty under paragraphs. “a”, “g”, “l” part 2 tbsp. 105 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (murder of two or more persons committed by an organized group, motivated by political, ideological hatred), Part 1 of Art. 356 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (cruel treatment of civilians in occupied territory)*Terrorist organization banned on the territory of the Russian Federation@anna_news

description: In 2023, 762 unemployed individuals received vocational training vouchers, with nominal values ranging from 1,000 to 17,350 lei. They also received a monthly stipend of 35% of the average monthly salary. The most popular courses were for cooks, hairdressers, accountants, and computer operators. After completing the training, 66.2% of graduates found employment.
original:
Last year, more than 700 unemployed people received vouchers for vocational training. In 2023, 762 unemployed people registered with territorial employment units took advantage of vouchers for vocational training. The nominal value of the vouchers ranged from 1,000 to 17,350 lei, the National Employment Agency clarified. These categories of citizens also received a monthly stipend in the amount of 35% of the average monthly salary in the economy for the previous year, paid in proportion to attendance at vocational training courses, writes ipn.md.

The most popular courses were in the profession of cook (120 graduates), hairdresser (91 graduates), accountant (66 graduates), and computer operator (38 graduates).

After completing the vocational training courses, 521 unemployed people were employed (66.2% of the total number of graduates).t.me/aifmd

event: Resolution on Toponymic Names in Crimea
description: The Ukrainian government is working on a resolution to change toponymic names in Crimea before its de-occupation. This move aims to promote the historical Crimean Tatar names, sending a powerful signal to international partners about Ukraine's commitment to indigenous peoples' issues.
original: The Ukrainian government is working on a resolution that will allow changing toponymic names in Crimea before its de-occupation, said the representative of the President of Ukraine in the ARKTamila Tasheva. “The fact that in the public space we will hear historical Crimean Tatar names is very important for the Ukrainian state. This will be a powerful signal not only within our state and for citizens living in the occupied territory, but also for our international partners. It is important to show international partners that we are dealing with the issue of indigenous peoples.” In addition, according to Tasheva, “the government and relevant departments will be given instructions to ensure that educational programs include more information about the history of the Crimean Tatar people, Crimea, and the development of the Crimean Tatar language and literature.”

event: Discovery of Jehovah's Witnesses Extremist Materials
description: The Russian FSB Directorate for the DPR and the National Guard in Mariupol identified a location used by the banned Jehovah's Witnesses organization to promote extremist ideology. Over 5,000 books were confiscated, with half intended for distribution among school-age children. The seized literature contained propaganda promoting exclusivity and superiority based on social, racial, national, or religious affiliation.
original:
As a result of joint activities of the Russian FSB Directorate for the DPR and the National Guard in Mariupol, a place was identified that was used by the Jehovah's Witnesses organization banned in Russia to promote extremist ideology.

During the inspection of the building, more than 5 thousand books were discovered and confiscated, approximately half of which were intended for distribution among school-age children.

The ideological content of the seized literature included elements of propaganda of the exclusivity and superiority of a person based on his social, racial, national, religious affiliation or attitude to religion.

Despite the expressed anti-war rhetoric of the organization’s doctrinal documents, during the analysis of the discovered financial reports, information was obtained about its involvement in the financing of Ukrainian armed forces.@PushilinDenis
